attributes.action: Augmentation Therapy For Rare Genetic Conditions
attributes.additional_details: Alpha 1 Antitrypsin Deficiency (A1AD) is a rare genetic condition causing the liver to produce zero to low levels of Antitrypsin mostly causing severe lung deterioration & or cancer of the liver and sometimes a rare terminal skin condition. There are 300 children suffering from A1AD at present no A1AD patients in the UK receive augmentation therapy bringing  the level of Antitrypsin up to normal levels of protection.  Appeal for augmentation therapy for rare genetic conditions in the UK.
